summary: Central European Time is a time zone.
full_text:
Central European Time , used in most parts of the European Union, is a standard time which is 1 hour ahead of Coordinated Universal Time . The time offset from UTC can be written as +01:00. The same standard time, UTC+01:00, is also known as Middle European Time  and under other names like Berlin Time, Romance Standard Time, Paris Time or Rome Time.
The 15th meridian east is the central axis for UTC+01:00 in the world system of time zones.
As of 2011 all member states of the European Union observe summer time; those that use CET during the winter use Central European Summer Time   in summer .
title: Central European Time
